utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I have a question about Batman. Batman is a man who dresses up like a bat. Man-bat is a part man, part bat hybrid. Now, if Man-Bat dressed up as a man to fight crime, would he be Man-Batman?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, he’d be Bat-Man-Bat.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: But wouldn’t Man-Batman just be a Batman that was bitten by a radioactive man?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: But Batman is a man. You’re talking about a man who would have the powers of a man. That’s just Man-Man.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, isn’t Man-Man just Man?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: But what if Man-Man dressed as a bat?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, that’s just Batman.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, if a man dresses as a bat, that’s Batman, but if Man-Man dresses as a bat, that’s Batman-Man.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So does that answer your question?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I haven’t asked it yet.

utterance.speaker: Raj (checking text on phone)
utterance.content: Oh, that’s Claire. Got to run.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I thought you were back with Emily.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, actually I’m seeing both of them.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You mean like through their window from behind a bush?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, I’m actually dating two women. Later.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really? The guy who for years couldn’t even talk to women is suddenly going out with two of them? How is that possible?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I know. Scientists have tried to reproduce it with computational models, but, in each case, the world blows up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Seriously, that guy’s dating two women?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What, why did you get a party sub?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: People are coming over, it looked fun.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, we’re only watching Game of Thrones. A party sub implies it’s a party.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Your attendance implies it’s not.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I like a party as much as the next man, as long as the next man doesn’t like a party. Oh, by the way, don’t forget, tomorrow is our quarterly roommate agreement meeting.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, Sheldon, we don’t need a meeting every three months.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hmm? Well, it sounds like the kind of thing one would bring up at a quarterly roommate agreement meeting. Lucky for you it’s tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, you know what? I’m not going.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, you have to go. It’s Penny’s first time leading the Pledge of Allegiance.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: This meeting is a waste of time. Whether we make the switch from Post Raisin Bran to Kellogg’s Raisin Bran should not require parliamentary procedure.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You realize one of them has sugar on the raisins.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re the only one who eats them.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And yet you get to weigh in. Democracy, it’s pretty cool, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m not going, you can’t make me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, we’ll just see about that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What is the problem?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He says he’s not coming to the roommate agreement meeting tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, why the hell did I memorize the Pledge?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You have fun. I will not be attending.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, fine. We don’t have to have a roommate agreement meeting if you don’t want to.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course, it will require a vote. Unfortunately, my official gavel is in my bedroom, but luckily, I have my travel gavel.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re being ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There’s a motion on the floor, I’m ridiculous. Do we have a second? Hmm? Hmm? There is no second. The motion is denied. Next time, make sure you have the votes first. That was embarrassing.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Can you please talk to him?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, why are you fighting him on this?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Because I am tired of him always getting his way. We don’t need a stupid meeting. We don’t even need a roommate agreement, and I hope that sandwich does cause a party.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I will still come to your meeting.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I should hope so. Tomorrow’s picture day.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why are you taking his side?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Because it’s important to him, and when we signed the roommate agreement, we made a deal.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You keep talking like that, you’re gonna make colour guard.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Man, I’m worn out.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I know. Imagine if we were actually moving.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, it’s just, ever since I started dating Claire and Emily at the same time, it’s exhausting.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re exhausted? Try folding every five pages in a pregnancy book so your wife thinks you read it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: But, dude, you’re so lucky. Getting to stay home at night with the woman you love.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I guess I am lucky.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You are, because dating two women, I mean, I can’t even remember the last time I slept in my own apartment. I wake up and I’m like, am I at Claire’s or am I at Emily’s? Is there a third girl I’ve forgotten about? Like, where am I?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hey, Raj.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, how’s the mommy-to-be?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Good. A little tired.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I feel you. I’ve been dating multiple women.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You sure you don’t want to come watch Game of Thrones with us?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You guys have fun. I’m just gonna snuggle up in bed with a book.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, that sounds great, a bed to yourself. Can’t even remember what that’s like.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you up-to-date on Game of Thrones?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mm, I think so. Dragons, snow zombies, and all the hot guys are dead.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know. Theon Greyjoy looks pretty good for a guy who had his genitals cut off.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh-oh, somebody’s still pouting.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Leave me alone.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: If it’s because you lost a stick, I know where it went.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Not funny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know you’re gonna make up with him. Can we just skip to that part?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, of course, because I’m the only adult around here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really? The only adult?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s right.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Tonight I’ll be watching a show rated M.A., and that stands for mature audiences, buster.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, you would think the only adult wouldn’t let something silly ruin our entire night.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And I’d think you’d understand why I’m annoyed.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All this could be avoided if you’d just come to the meeting.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t want to.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, it’s just a meeting. One simple meeting.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Stop saying meeting.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Meeting, meeting, bo-beeting, banana-fana, fo-feeting, fee-fi mo-meeting.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I brought my famous spinach dip.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, Amy, just one second. Meeting.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m not sure if I’m hoping for a boy or a girl. I mean, if it’s a boy, I’m gonna have to teach him to play catch. Which means I’m gonna have to google how to play catch. If it’s a girl, I mean, they’re so innocent and you know how guys are.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Totally, guys are the worst. I mean, look at me. I let Emily make me a frittata and I kept the leftovers in Claire’s fridge that night. I’m such a dog.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: There you go again.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m sorry, have I been complaining about it too much?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Actually, what you’re doing is pretending to complain, but really trying to brag.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: How could you say that?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, I wish could enjoy a cup of tea without a naked girl bouncing up and down on me.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I never said that.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Don’t you hate it when you can’t remember whose bra it is you found wedged in your couch?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, that I said. But that’s a real problem. You give a girl another woman’s bra, and you will not be having sex with her that night. Maybe the other girl, but not her.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What’s going on with him?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, he’s all bent out of shape about having a roommate agreement meeting.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Apparently, perfect attendance isn’t cool any more.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Don’t worry, he’ll come around.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, I get why he’s annoyed.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, then you don’t understand what’s happening. See, Leonard refused to participate in a mandatory quarterly roommate agreement meeting. This is what a generation raised on Bart Simpson looks like.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You love The Simpsons.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I love Lisa Simpson.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, I know how he feels. I never enjoyed our relationship agreement meetings.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait. You were pretending?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. I don’t believe you. I could tell.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, Sheldon, I never thought re-filing a matter in a standing subcommittee could be so fascinating.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hmm, what do you think?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You don’t know?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, did I say something to upset you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Really? Because usually we walk side by side, and I just went up two flights of stairs staring at your bottom.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Just drop it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, I think I see what’s happening here. You’re jealous of me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, please. What could you possibly have that I would be jealous of?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s not what I have, it’s how many people I’m having it with.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come on, Sheldon, we’ll watch Game of Thrones over here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Gladly.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, good, go. You know, it’ll be nice to watch an episode without someone saying, I read the books, don’t get too fond of this character.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s not always because they die. In one case, it’s because they’ve become involved with underground tree people from the dawn of time. Yeah, but I won’t say who it is. It’s Brann.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wait, what is going on?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard’s being a jerk, so we’re gonna watch over here.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Do you guys want to watch with us?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: As long as I don’t have to watch with him.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Fine, I don’t want to watch with you either. I’ll go over here.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why do you get to pick?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, then you go there.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Don’t tell me where to go.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Howard, just come in here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, come on, Raj.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wait, did Amy make her spinach dip?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: She did.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And I’m gonna eat it all.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So what the hell happened?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, I just ran out of patience with Sheldon’s nonsense.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Tell me about it. I’ve had it with Raj, too.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You know, like women, men have a monthly hormone cycle. Dips in testosterone can cause irritability.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Interesting. Maybe my male cycle synced up with Raj’s actual period.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If Sheldon’s testosterone dipped, he’d become a butterfly. Oh. Maybe someone’s here to apologize.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Hey, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Uh, is this not a dress-up party?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Was it ever a dress-up party?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Howard, didn’t you tell me it was a dress-up party?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I was told this is where to go if I’m mad at Howard.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: May I take your cloak?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Thanks. This thing kept getting caught in the chain of my bike.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I’ll catch you up. Uh, Penny is angry at Leonard, Leonard’s angry at me and Penny, I’m angry at Leonard and Amy, Raj is angry at Howard, and I’m angry at George R.R. Martin ’cause there are no new books for me to spoil for Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: So what happened with you and Howard?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Says I was talking too much about dating Claire and Emily, and I accused him of being jealous.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I’m jealous. Closest I’ve come to dating two women was that time I dated one woman.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know how you put up with it. He’s impossible. I mean, holding a meeting to decide what breakfast cereal we should buy.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah. Cap’n Crunch with Crunch Berries, move on.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Anyway, Amy, thank you for sticking up for me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, I honestly couldn’t care less.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sorry?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, I just took your side ’cause sometimes I get annoyed at how close Sheldon and Penny are.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, they argue all the time. They aren’t that close.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Who’s always comforting him when he’s upset?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny, but…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Who’s the only one who can make him take his medicine when he’s sick?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I try to hide it in his peanut butter, but he spits it out.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay. And did you know she has him add things to the roommate agreement so she can get her way and not fight with you about it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Son of a bitch. Why is that funny?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t know. I like the pain of others.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, well, then you’ll enjoy this. Bernadette does the same thing with you and Koothrappali.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, she doesn’t.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: She defends him all the time.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She does not.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Who told you to stop making all those Gandhi jokes about him?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, she did. And human resources.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Who do you think told Koothrappali to go to human resources?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Son of a bitch.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re, you’re right, it feels good.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: All right, it’s almost game time. Get it? Game of Thrones, game time?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Two women, huh?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (at knock on door)
utterance.content: Oh, perhaps it’s Amy coming to her senses.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know, you don’t need to use Sheldon to get your way with me in a dumb roommate agreement.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Where’d you get that from?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: From Amy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ugh. Amy, why did you tell him that?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Because you were defending Sheldon like you always do.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t always defend Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, yes, you do. You know you have a weird brother-sister-Elliott-E.T. relationship with him.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What about your weird relationship with him?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s different. I’m like the little girl in Poltergeist and he’s the creepy thing in the TV.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Um, guys? Were there any nuts in that food?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t think so. Why?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well just a feeling.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It just said Italian sub. I had no idea mortadella has pistachios in it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Interesting fact, in Italian, the morta in mortadella means death.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I didn’t say fun fact. I’m not a monster.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: He’s gonna be okay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Now it’s a fun fact.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Boy, stuff like this really puts things in perspective.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Why are you dressed like that?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, uh, Howard thought it’d be funny to tell me it was a costume party.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That wasn’t nice.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: No, but he almost died, so we’re cool.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know, if you think about it, tonight was kind of like a real-life Game of Thrones.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, Howard eating that pistachio was like when King Joffrey got poisoned.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, well, that was murder, this was an accident.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay. But you using Sheldon to do your dirty work is like when Cersei used the King’s Guard to do her bidding.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Cersei uses her body to manipulate men. Penny just takes me to The LEGO Store.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay. Oh, how about this? Stuart’s dressed like a brother of the Night’s Watch, and they don’t have sex.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: There you go.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s true.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fair enough.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You all right?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m fine. Just a little embarrassed I had to be carried down the stairs like a baby. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Let’s get out of here.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That was scary.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, the important thing is I said that big sandwich would ruin everything, and I was right.

utterance.speaker: Raj (shouting from upstairs window)
utterance.content: Hey, Jon Snow. How come your horse has a basket on it?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: How come your head has your face on it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: They don’t wear bicycle helmets in Game of Thrones. You’re thematically inaccurate, but I applaud your commitment to safety.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Don’t you guys have anything better to do?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Better than watching a guy in a fur cloak ride a girl’s bike? Nope.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: That’s it, you just lost bathroom privileges at the comic book store. Horse has a basket on it. Stupid… aaargh!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard. Leonard. Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I never got to ask my question about Batman.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If Batman were bitten by a radioactive Man-Bat, and then fought crime disguised as Man-Bat, would he be Man-Bat-Man-Bat-Man or simply Man-Bat-Man-Bat-Batman?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Is he still wearing the Batman suit under the Man-Bat suit?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ll be back.
